results.title: Is Hollywood Doing Fine With Oklahoma?
results.abstract: The Matt Damon film “Stillwater” is one of the rare times that the state gets some degree of a movie spotlight.

results.title: From ‘Call My Agent!’ to Hollywood Career
results.abstract: The French series was a pandemic hit in the United States. And now its star, Camille Cottin, is emerging to find herself in demand.

multimedia.caption: “You tell me during the pandemic everybody watched ‘Call My Agent!’ I was miles away, imagining that I was buried alive,” Camille Cottin said.
multimedia.copyright: Tania Franco Klein for The New York Times

results.abstract: The mega-budget comedic adventure took in $34 million in North America and $30 million on Disney+ worldwide.

results.title: Zazie Beetz Grew Up With Shel Silverstein and Nina Simone
results.abstract: The “Atlanta” actress talks about her latest film, “Nine Days,” her desire to become a doula, her love affair with all things French, and how Debussy and Lianne La Havas got her through some difficult times.

results.title: Dev Patel, Starry Knight
results.abstract: “The Green Knight” offered the actor a movie-star moment unlike anything he’s done before. Could he conquer his insecurities and take the lead?

multimedia.caption: Dev Patel said he tends to overthink his career. It’s “paralysis by analysis,” he said.

results.title: After Uproar, Matt Damon Tries to Clarify Comments on Anti-Gay Slur
results.abstract: The actor was recently quoted as saying that he had decided to “retire” the word his daughter calls the “f-slur” after she objected to a joke he made.

results.title: Scarlett Johansson Sues Disney Over ‘Black Widow’ Release
results.abstract: The star said making the film available on Disney+ at the same time it opened in theaters “dramatically” lowered box office revenue, which could cost her tens of millions of dollars.
results.byline: By Brooks Barnes and Nicole Sperling

results.title: ‘The Macaluso Sisters’ Review: Tragedy Across Time
results.abstract: This moving drama by the filmmaker Emma Dante imagines the ripple effects of a sister’s death across generations in Sicily.

results.title: ‘Bix’ Review: A Jazz Legend Fondly Remembered
results.abstract: The composer and cornet player Bix Beiderbecke changed music forever in a very short life. A restored documentary from the ’80s goes into the details.
des_facet: Bix: 'Ain't None of Them Play Like Him Yet' (Movie)

results.title: ‘Vivo’ Review: A Musical Tale That Goes Offbeat
results.abstract: The animated musical, about a kinkajou who goes on a journey to deliver a song, may have an uneven story, but the movie’s stellar songs, by Lin-Manuel Miranda, reflect the artist at his best.

results.title: A New Improv Theater Tries to Be the Anti-U.C.B. Is That a Trap, Too?
results.abstract: A diverse board of comics is trying to build an inclusive, accessible institution. But knowing what they don’t want to be may not be enough.

results.title: Marsha Mason’s ‘New York Loft in a Hayfield’
results.abstract: After more than two decades in New Mexico, the actress and director is back on the East Coast, with new digs and a renewed focus on the theater.

results.title: In ‘Mr. Corman,’ Joseph Gordon-Levitt Looks Inward and Asks, ‘What If?’
results.abstract: For his new Apple TV+ comedy series, Gordon-Levitt imagined what his life might have been like if he hadn’t been so lucky. “It’s probably the most me-ish thing I’ve ever made.”

multimedia.caption: “I’m really lucky to be me,” said Joseph Gordon-Levitt, who at 40 has been working in show business professionally for over three decades. “Lots of people work really hard and haven’t reaped my rewards.”
multimedia.copyright: Dina Litovsky for The New York Times

results.title: No Lion, the Skipper Is the Real King of the Jungle Cruise
results.abstract: Bad jokes and puns are part of a Disneyland job that has been immortalized in a new film. Those who’ve held the role at the theme park never really leave it behind.
